definition: (math.) equals sign =
class/rank/grade/equal to/same as/to wait for/to await/et cetera/and so on/et al. (and other authors)/after/as soon as/once
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
roar/cry/CL:個|个[ge4]
inequality sign (≠, < , ≤, >, ≥)
to equate/to consider (two things) to be equivalent

sentences.english: You ever hear white people callin' each other honky all the time?
sentences.chinese: 你什麼時辰聽過白人互相等號“白鬼”嗎，兄弟？

sentences.english: If AX=B, then let's multiply both sides by A inverse.
sentences.chinese: 如果AX=B，在等號兩邊同時乘以A逆。

sentences.english: Trying to be fashionable seems too stereotypically , well, feminine.
sentences.chinese: 時尚的着裝似乎總是會和過於女性化劃上等號。

sentences.english: What does an equal sign do?
sentences.chinese: 一個等號是用來做什麼的？

sentences.english: and it's a combination of looks and confidence that we often equate with smarts.
sentences.chinese: 而長相與自信的結合通常會讓人與聰明畫上等號。

sentences.english: Modern world history was not the history of capitalist society.
sentences.chinese: 世界近代史不能同資本主義史畫等號。
這種姿勢通常同懶散畫上等號。

sentences.english: This system equates intelligence with a knowledge of English which is quite arbitrary.
sentences.chinese: 這個體制把智能和英語能力畫上等號這是相當武斷的。

sentences.english: Out of the blue, Neil detected the voter's identification of the Democrats with high taxes.
sentences.chinese: 在意外中，尼爾發現選民把民黨和高稅收畫上了等號。

sentences.english: The mistake of equating empowerment with freedom must be avoided.
sentences.chinese: 應避免把賦予權力與自由畫上等號的錯誤。

definition: to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to force someone to do something
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
variant of 獨角戲|独角戏[du2 jiao3 xi4]
as to/considering/for
harmony is to be prized
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to break a code/to crack a riddle/to solve an enigma/a breakthrough
pendulum
to be determined to win (idiom)
derivation/to deduce
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
tight knot/intractable problem
